summary:
The Security Council:

Recalling previous resolutions and its Presidential Statement on Libya,
Reaffirming commitment to Libya's sovereignty and territorial integrity,
Welcoming the Secretary-General's report on the situation,
 
Condemns migrant smuggling and human trafficking in and around Libya, endangering hundreds of thousands of people.

Decides to:
1. Renew authorisations from resolution 2240 (2015) for 12 months.
2. Reaffirm previous resolutions and Presidential Statement.
3. Renew reporting requests on implementation.

Requests the Secretary-General to report on implementation after 11 months.

Intends to review the situation and consider renewing authority.

Decides to remain seized of the matter.
